attributes.content: Mutare City Council is a statutory body that was established in terms of the Constitution of the Republic of Zimbabwe (Amendment 20 of 2013, Chapter 14 Section 274 and the Urban Councils Act Chapter 29:15) and is charged with the responsibility of providing services to the residents in its area of jurisdiction. body.value:
The Ministry of Finance and Economic Affairs (MOFEA) of The Gambia plays a crucial role in the economic management and development of the country. It is responsible for formulating and implementing financial policies, strategies, and regulations that promote sustainable economic growth, fiscal stability, and social development.

MOFEA oversees the management of public finances, including budget formulation and execution, revenue mobilization, debt management, and financial planning. The ministry also plays a key role in coordinating donor assistance and external financial relations on behalf of The Gambia.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Kuwait Fund For Arab Economic Development holds the distinction of being the first institution in the Middle East to actively engage in international development efforts. It extends loans on concessional terms to finance development projects in developing countries. Additionally, the Fund provides technical assistance to cover the costs of feasibility studies for projects and facilitates training for nationals of borrowing countries. Furthermore, it subscribes to the capital of international and regional development institutions.

body.value: The Kuwait Fund For Arab Economic Development holds the distinction of being the first institution in the Middle East to actively engage in international development efforts. It extends loans on concessional terms to finance development projects in developing countries. Additionally, the Fund provides technical assistance to cover the costs of feasibility studies for projects and facilitates training for nationals of borrowing countries. Furthermore, it subscribes to the capital of international and regional development institutions. Today, the Kuwait Fund serves as a robust bridge fostering friendship and solidarity between Kuwait and nations in the developing world.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Korea-Africa Economic Cooperation (KOAFEC) Conference, established in 2006, serves as a biennial platform to advance Koreas development efforts in Africa. Managed by the KOAFEC secretariat with guidance from the Consultative Group of the African Development Bank, the conference focuses on achieving concrete outcomes through technical assistance and investments in energy, ICT, human resources, agriculture, green growth, and knowledge sharing.

body.value: The Korea-Africa Economic Cooperation (KOAFEC) Conference, established in 2006, serves as a biennial platform to advance Koreas development efforts in Africa. Managed by the KOAFEC secretariat with guidance from the Consultative Group of the African Development Bank, the conference focuses on achieving concrete outcomes through technical assistance and investments in energy, ICT, human resources, agriculture, green growth, and knowledge sharing. Key components include the Ministerial Round Table for policy dialogue among African Ministers and international bodies, and the Business Forum, highlighting the growing involvement of the private sector in development collaborations.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Gambia is a multi-party democratic republic. The President of the Republic, who is directly elected by universal adult suffrage, is the Head of State and holds executive authority. Legislative authority is vested in a unicameral parliament called the National Assembly. The legal system is based on a composite of common law, Koranic law, and customary law. The judicial system is composed of lower courts such as the Magistrates Court, Khadis (Muslim) Courts, and District tribunals, and at the higher level, there is the Supreme Court and The Gambia Court of Appeal.

The judicial system is composed of lower courts such as the Magistrates Court, Khadis (Muslim) Courts, and District tribunals, and at the higher level, there is the Supreme Court and The Gambia Court of Appeal.

The firm's expertise spans various types of residential and commercial construction, with a particular focus on large-scale public infrastructure projects.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The AfCFTA is the worlds largest free trade area bringing together the 55 countries of the African Union (AU) and eight (8) Regional Economic Communities (RECs). The AfCFTA is one of the flagship projects of Agenda 2063: The Africa We Want, the African Unions long-term development strategy for transforming the continent into a global powerhouse. The overarching aim of the AfCFTA is to raise the living conditions of the people of Africa.

body.value: The AfCFTA is the worlds largest free trade area bringing together the 55 countries of the African Union (AU) and eight (8) Regional Economic Communities (RECs). The AfCFTA is one of the flagship projects of Agenda 2063: The Africa We Want, the African Unions long-term development strategy for transforming the continent into a global powerhouse. The overarching aim of the AfCFTA is to raise the living conditions of the people of Africa. The AfCFTA is therefore mandated to harmonize trade rules and empower African countries to trade easily by providing a platform for negotiating trade agreements and addressing matters of concern to each Member State.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Government of Liberia is structured like that of the United States, with executive, legislative, and judicial branches. Political parties were legalized in 1984, leading to civilian rule in 1986. However, political unrest from the mid-1990s to early 2000s disrupted stability until a 2003 power-sharing agreement established a National Transitional Government (NTG) supported by UN peacekeeping troops. This government replaced the 1986 constitution administration and lasted until a democratically elected government was formed in 2006.

body.value: The Government of Liberia is structured like that of the United States, with executive, legislative, and judicial branches. Political parties were legalized in 1984, leading to civilian rule in 1986. However, political unrest from the mid-1990s to early 2000s disrupted stability until a 2003 power-sharing agreement established a National Transitional Government (NTG) supported by UN peacekeeping troops. This government replaced the 1986 constitution administration and lasted until a democratically elected government was formed in 2006. Liberia operates as a multiparty republic, with the president serving as head of state and government for a six-year term, and a bicameral National Assembly elected for six- and nine-year terms. The country is divided into 15 counties, each led by a presidentially appointed superintendent.

attributes.content: The World Bank Group, comprising 189 member countries and staff from over 170 nations, operates in more than 130 locations. This unique partnership includes five institutions focused on sustainable solutions to reduce poverty and promote shared prosperity in developing countries. Facing multiple interconnected crises, the World Bank Group emphasizes the need for a new strategy that is inclusive, resilient, and sustainable.

attributes.content: The government of Zimbabwe is a unitary presidential republic with a multi-party system. The President acts as both head of state and government, and the legislative branch is bicameral, comprising the Senate and the House of Assembly. Since independence in 1980, Zimbabwe has encountered significant political challenges, including economic crises and human rights issues. The Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front (ZANU-PF) has been the dominant political party, raising concerns about the integrity of democratic processes.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Anambra governance structure proves Aristotles political theory of over a thousand years. Aristotle said, If liberty and equality, as is thought by some, are chiefly to be found in democracy, they will be best attained when all persons alike share in the Government to the utmost Ndi Anambra has been in pursuit of both liberty and equity all through history.

body.value: Anambra governance structure proves Aristotles political theory of over a thousand years. Aristotle said, If liberty and equality, as is thought by some, are chiefly to be found in democracy, they will be best attained when all persons alike share in the Government to the utmost Ndi Anambra has been in pursuit of both liberty and equity all through history. Governance in Anambra State is based on the 1999 constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria which provides for a Three-Tier governance structure of federal, State, and local Government each having an executive, legislative and judicial arm. Since the return of Democratic rule in 1999, Anambra State, like every other State in Nigeria has an executive arm of Government led by an elected Governor, a legislative arm that is made up of the elected members of the House of assembly and the Judiciary headed by the Chief Judge of the State.

attributes.content: Adamawa State, also known as the Land of Beauty, was established on August 27, 1991, alongside Taraba State, emerging from the former Gongola State with Yola as its capital.Situated in the North-East of Nigeria, it covers a substantial land area of 36,917 square kilometers, ranking as the 8th largest state in Nigeria, just behind Zamfara at 7th. The state shares borders with Borno State to the Northwest, Gombe State to the West, and Taraba State to the Southwest, while also having international borders with Cameroon to the East.

body.value: Adamawa State, also known as the Land of Beauty, was established on August 27, 1991, alongside Taraba State, emerging from the former Gongola State with Yola as its capital. Situated in the North-East of Nigeria, it covers a substantial land area of 36,917 square kilometers, ranking as the 8th largest state in Nigeria, just behind Zamfara at 7th. The state shares borders with Borno State to the Northwest, Gombe State to the West, and Taraba State to the Southwest, while also having international borders with Cameroon to the East. Adamawa State is divided into 3 senatorial districts, 8 federal constituencies, and 21 local government areas.

attributes.content: Natural Eco Capital is a sustainability firm focused on helping stakeholders, particularly financial institutions and governments, integrate biodiversity and natural capital into their business strategies. As a member of the Natural Capital Coalition, the company addresses key sustainability issues, including climate change and the circular economy. Since its establishment in March 2016, it has promoted the Circular Economy in Nigeria through tailored recycling solutions that create jobs for vulnerable groups, such as women, youth, and returning migrants.

attributes.content: MDBL, established in 1952, began its journey as a partnership in Mombasa, focusing on building activities. Initially, the company operated on a small scale, engaging primarily in renovations of residential buildings and the construction of simple residences, go-downs, and offices. Over the years, MDBL has evolved from these modest beginnings into a significant player in the construction industry, expanding its capabilities and project scope.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Razel-Bec is a leading civil engineering and infrastructure company under the Fayat Group, a prominent family-owned business in France's construction and industry sectors. Established in 1957 by Clment Fayat, Razel-Bec has grown to operate internationally, offering high-performance technical solutions in various civil works projects. These include dams, tunnels, bridges, and roads, as well as industrial civil projects such as water treatment plants, waste treatment plants, and nuclear plants.

body.value: Razel-Bec is a leading civil engineering and infrastructure company under the Fayat Group, a prominent family-owned business in France's construction and industry sectors. Established in 1957 by Clment Fayat, Razel-Bec has grown to operate internationally, offering high-performance technical solutions in various civil works projects. These include dams, tunnels, bridges, and roads, as well as industrial civil projects such as water treatment plants, waste treatment plants, and nuclear plants. With a turnover of 750 million euros in 2018 and a workforce of 5,000 employees, Razel-Bec continues to innovate and expand its global footprint.
